If the suus heres was born in the lifetime of the testator, the revocation of the will would not be an irremediable evil, because the testator would still have it in bis power to make another will, and according-ly in this case the civil law lest, the general rule to operate. But if the suus heres were born after the death of the testator, the evil ‚would be irreparable, and the testator would die intestate.
